items.sentence: Someone must\'ve taken your umbrella by mistake.
Tom and Mary weren\'t at home yesterday evening.
I should\'ve realized the truth a long time ago.
I could hear Tom and Mary yelling at each other.
I decided to stay a couple extra days in Boston.
Tom doesn\'t speak French as fluently as you do.
Tom\'s driver\'s license will expire next month.
Tom\'s eyesight isn\'t as good as it used to be.
Tom\'s not coming, because I don\'t want him to.
Tom\'s problems are nothing compared to Mary\'s.
I had knee replacement surgery three months ago.
I want you to go to your room and lock the door.
Our school became coeducational a long time ago.
She was absent from school because she was sick.
Some of my friends can speak French fairly well.
The company decided to hire two new secretaries.
The doctor advised him not to eat between meals.
Tom isn\'t here yet. He must\'ve missed the bus.
That car\'s so big that parking it is difficult.
That happened to you since you weren\'t careful.
You have a dictionary, don\'t you? Can I use it?
You ought to ask for your teacher\'s permission.
You should\'ve apologized to Tom for being late.
I didn\'t want to spend any more time in Boston.
I don\'t eat Chinese food as often as I used to.
I don\'t even know if I want to do this anymore.
I don\'t have enough space to store these boxes.
Tom was lying when he said he didn\'t know Mary.
Tom was seated in the driver\'s seat of the car.
Tom wanted to feel loved and accepted by others.
Tom was a mean man before his daughter was born.
Are you sure you don\'t want to ask Tom to help?
Tom still drinks, but not as much as he used to.
Tom suggested that I change the lock on my door.
Tom was a little overweight when he was a child.
We postponed our departure because of the storm.
Tom is wearing a coat that\'s too large for him.
Tom isn\'t allowed to do just anything he wants.
Tom isn\'t as good at French as you think he is.
Tom doesn\'t yet know exactly when he\'ll leave.
Why don\'t you tell us what happened last night?
Can eating just vegetables help you lose weight?
Can you direct me to the nearest subway station?
Can you tell me how to get to the train station?
Can you understand the meaning of this sentence?
Could you come back here again tomorrow at 2:30?
Could you move forward so we can close the door?
Tom took a twenty dollar bill out of his pocket.
Tom understands French better than he speaks it.
Tom used to smoke two packs of cigarettes a day.
